clinical_study.brief_title: Outcome of Intravenous Thrombolysis for Stroke Patients in the 3-4.5 Hour Time Window
clinical_study.official_title: The Feasibility and Outcome of Intravenous Thrombolysis for Stroke Patients in the 3-4.5 Hour Time Window in China

lead_sponsor.agency: Wuhan General Hospital of Guangzhou Military Command

clinical_study.source: Wuhan General Hospital of Guangzhou Military Command

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

brief_summary.textblock: The time window for intravenous recombinant tissue plasminogen activator treatment in ischemic stroke patients has been extended to 4.5h. Little is known about intravenous recombinant tissue plasminogen activator use in the 3-4.5 hour time window among Chinese stroke patients. This exploratory study was to describe the feasibility and outcome of treatment with intravenous recombinant tissue plasminogen activator in the expanded time window, and to offer suggestions for future clinical work in China.

detailed_description.textblock: Favorable clinical outcome of intravenous recombinant tissue plasminogen activator was assessed by absolute changes in the National Institute of Health Stroke Scale score at 24 hours and by the improvement of modified Rankin Scale score at discharge or 6-month follow-up. The safety of intravenous recombinant tissue plasminogen activator was assessed by the rate of mortality, intracerebral hemorrhage and other common complications. Multivariate logistic regression models were used to evaluate factors associated with favorable clinical outcome.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case Control, Time Perspective: Prospective

primary_outcome.measure: National Institute of Health Stroke Scale score and modified Rankin Scale
primary_outcome.time_frame: Outcome measure will be assessed at 24 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Favorable clinical outcome of intravenous recombinant tissue plasminogen activator was assessed by absolute changes in the National Institute of Health Stroke Scale score at 24 hours and by the improvement of modified Rankin Scale score at discharge or 6-month follow-up

arm_group.description: Stroke patients with rt-PA treatment in the 3-4.5 hour time window were compared with those within 3h.
One group of was treated with standard recombinant tissue plasminogen activator therapy in 3h and the other group of stroke patients was treated within 3-4.5h.

study_pop.textblock: stroke patients in the 3-4.5 hour time window

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:stroke patients in the 3-4.5 hour time window -
Exclusion Criteria:stroke patients in more than 4.5 hour time window
-
